byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Some Iraqis expressed relief at the news of prison terms for four former security contractors in the killings of 14 people in 2007, while others called for harsher punishments.

headline.print_headline: Conviction of Blackwater Guards Closes Painful Chapter for Iraqis
headline.main: Sentences in Blackwater Killings Give Iraqis a Measure of Closure

snippet: Some Iraqis expressed relief at the news of prison terms for four former security contractors in the killings of 14 people in 2007, while others called for harsher punishments.
abstract: Conviction of four former Blackwater security contractors in killings of 17 Iraqis in 2007 gives Iraqi civilians whose lives were traumatized by incident a chance for closure; some are relieved at prison terms handed out, but others demand stricter sentences.
